events.info: Consensual sexual acts between men were decriminalized with the changes introduced into the article 121 'Sodomy' of RSFSR's Criminal Code. Women's homosexuality was not initially mentioned in this article.
Russia adopted a new classification of diseases (ICD-10), which excluded the diagnosis of "homosexuality".

span_description: No meaningful changes: necessary laws prohibiting discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity were not adopted.
span_info: Those convicted of "sodomy" were not included as victims of political repression and were not subject to rehabilitation.

events.info: Start of institutional discrimination. The "gay propaganda" law in the Ryazan region banned the so-called "propaganda of homosexuality among minors".

span_description: 11 more regions adopted the "gay propaganda" law

events.description: The "gay propaganda" law is extended nationwide
events.info: The first version of the Federal law on "gay propaganda". Law No. 135-FZ introduced "propaganda of non-traditional sexual relations among minors" as an administrative offense.

note: The data we collected from court decisions shows an increse in the number of hate crimes against LGBTQ+ people

events.info: Article 72 of the Constitution defined marriage as the union of a man and a woman. The further adoption of laws on same-sex unions would be impossible without constitutional reform.

events.description: The second version of the "gay propaganda" law
events.info: Federal Law No. 479-FZ established administrative responsibility for "propaganda of non-traditional sexual relations" in general (not only among minors). In addition, this law banned the so-called "propaganda of pedophilia" and "propaganda of gender change"

Federal Law No. 386-FZ abolished the existing system of medical and legal procedures for transgender transition since Soviet times. Trans people effectively no longer have the opportunity to receive necessary assistance.

events.description: Supreme Court: "International LGBT movement" is an extremist organisation
events.info: Hybrid recriminalization of homosexuality. By its Decision of November 30, the Supreme Court of Russia labeled the so-called "International LGBT Movement" as an extremist organization. This effectively means that open identification as LGBTQ+ can lead to criminal liability for participation in an extremist organization.
